items.content_html:
Description

This PR fulfills three purposes:

  1. It provides a centralized place to document all built-in iterators and their function, allowing us to explain why all built-in iterators are iterable, in particular Generator, which has a page of its own.
  2. It enables me to document the full prototype chain of generators, which I will do in a future PR.
  3. It is preparatory work for documenting https://github.com/tc39/proposal-iterator-helpers, which exposes these hidden objects.
  4. BCD data actually exists for these, so let's provide the content.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Document hidden Iterator/AsyncIterator object

items.content_html:
Addresses: https://github.com/orgs/mdn/discussions/353#discussioncomment-5491423

As HTML5 uses a new classification now(content categories), the PR removes Inline_elements and Block-level_elements pages from HTML tree. And adds block-level and inline-level glossary pages as CSS concepts.
items.title: CSS: move block-level and inline-level pages from HTML to CSS

items.content_html: This PR removes the displayName member of the Function JavaScript builtin. See mdn/browser-compat-data#19311 for more details.
items.title: Remove Function.displayName

items.content_html:
Part of mdn/mdn#280. @estelle , @captainbrosset .

This needs to land alongside mdn/yari#8238, which defines the new sidebar for the PWA docs.

This PR updates the content of https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps to fit into the new organization we've defined. Since we haven't finished updating the content, it includes lots of the existing content and tries to fit it into the new structure, while also exposing the new content in the nav for the first time.

Once this lands we will be able to incrementally add more content into this structure and remove any existing content that we have superseded, until we are done.

So the goal of this PR is to have a place where we can expose the new stuff and the old stuff, as a temporary measure.

To do this I started by looking at the content of the existing sidebar:

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Installable_PWAs
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Re-engageable_Notifications_Push
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Introduction
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Offline_Service_workers
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Loading
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/App_structure
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Add_to_home_screen
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Installing
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Structural_overview

So of these 9 pages:

  • six of them are more or less following the development of the js13kgames sample app, like a tutorial. They're not exactly a tutorial, because the pages mix up guide and tutorial content. But they do walk through js13kgames, and they have next/previous links, like a multipart tutorial So for now I've called this a tutorial. I expect eventually these pages will all be superseded by the new tutorial. This covers the following pages:
    • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Introduction
    • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/App_structure
    • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Installable_PWAs
    • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Re-engageable_Notifications_Push
    • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Loading
    • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Offline_Service_workers
  • one, https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Add_to_home_screen is I think already superseded by https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Guides/Making_PWAs_installable, so I deleted it and redirected there
  • one, https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Installing, is currently being rewritten by Estelle, so I have left it where it is, so as not to cause merge conflicts. When Estelle's PR is merged we can move it into Guides.
  • one, https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Structural_overview, I have moved into Guides, but I think we will eventually rewrite or delete it.

I've also written little landing pages for things like https://pr25888.content.dev.mdn.mozit.cloud/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Guides.

I have not rewritten the landing page yet, because this PR was already quite complicated.

To test this (and the sidebar) you'd need to:

  • check out this branch
  • check out mdn/yari#8238
  • point that yari branch at this content one, using CONTENT_ROOT: https://github.com/mdn/yari/blob/main/docs/REVIEWING.md
  • run yarn dev
  • visit http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps, and the pages linked in the sidebar.
items.title: [PWA] PWA reorg

items.content_html:
Description

Missing encoding of the waveform. Because the parameter is a Float32Array, one can reasonably assume that the encoding is f32 (that is, PCM data amplitude in [-1:1]). However it would be better to confirm this in writing instead of leaving developers to their guess. There's also no mention of planar/non-planar encoding, which is necessary to do anything with the data retrieved (unless the signal has a single channel).

Added text - "The time-domain data is encoded in f32 format with the amplitude of samples in [-1:1]" for the following urls for clarity :

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/getFloatFrequencyData
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/getFloatTimeDomainData

Motivation

Better clarity for users going through the docs

Related issues and pull requests

Issue :- #25571
items.title: added clear message of the data encoded by using float32array

items.content_html:
Description

The area element is listed under the hreflang attribute, even though the attribute is deprecated for this element.

Motivation

The element listing should be correct and up to date.

Additional details

The reference for the area element says that the hreflang attribute is deprecated.
The attribute is also not listed in the HTML standard specification.

Related issues and pull requests

/

items.content_html:
Description

This PR changes the crisp-edges value of the image-rendering CSS property used in the exmaple on Crisp pixel art look with image-rendering to pixelated. Also, the outdated note on the experimental status of image-rendering is removed.

Motivation

pixelated has much wider support than crisp-edges now, so changing to this value enables the example to work on more browsers.

Additional details

Mozilla bug for implementing image-rendering: pixelated:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=856337#c57

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #25770.
items.title: Change `crisp-edges` to `pixelated` for Games' example

items.content_html:
Summary

From Fx112, overlay will be recognized as a value for overflow (fixed in this bug).

Update in spec:

User agents must also support the overlay keyword as a legacy value alias of auto.

Description of changes

In addition to the changes related to overlay, the following changes have been made:

  • Two glossary pages, Scroll container and Scrollport, have been updated so that the verbiage is similar in both the pages and matches that used on the overflow page. The redundant "See also" section in both the pages has been removed.
  • Minor 1-sentence addition has been made to the overflow-clip-margin, overflow-x, and overflow-y pages.
  • Major rewrites have been done on the overflow page to:
    • include all the information in the spec.
    • make all the keyword descriptions follow the same order of information.
    • change the overlay keyword info to a note because the spec still lists five possible keywords (visible | hidden | clip | scroll | auto) in the syntax.
    • add clip to the example.
    • move the external link in the "Accessibility concerns" section to the "See also" section.
    • format the "See also" section to group similar properties into separate list items. Also to remove the Firefox-specific link (Debug scrollable overflow).

To Dos

  • Update overlay info in the browser compat table
  • Update firefox release note

Related issues

Doc issue tracker: #25355
Bug tracker: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1817189
Spec: https://w3c.github.io/csswg-drafts/css-overflow/#overflow-control
items.title: docs(fx112-css-overflow): Add note for 'overlay' and update other descriptions
